column4: PURPOSE / LOGIC RULE
Validates settings, launches Worker process, and updates GUI state.
Terminated Worker via PID and reverts GUI to inactive state.
Triggers full stop/restart of Worker to refresh memory/logic.
Calls RestoreDefaultSettings(*) and refreshes GUI visuals.
Orchestrates UI visibility for Dashboard, Settings, and Anti-Ban.
Handles nested navigation (General vs Script settings).
Monitors GUI inputs and triggers SaveSetting() for INI persistence.
Modifies Dashboard status text and color indicators.
Ensures Worker is killed before Controller exits.
Logic for resetting INI values and GUI controls to defaults.
Static wrapper that calls the global UpdateLog function.
Saves new game title to INI and pushes live IPC update to Worker.
Debounced timer function for logging title changes.
Low-level IPC implementation using WM_COPYDATA (0x004A).
Switches visibility for primary GUI tab groups and handles placeholder hints.
Manages sub-navigation visibility between General and Script settings.
Manages sub-navigation visibility between Anti-Ban Features and Tuning.
GUI close event; handles Minimize to Tray logic or application exit.
Handles lifecycle, initial launch, and state changes of the Worker.
Timer-based watchdog monitoring if the Worker process is still running.
Ensures the Worker process is closed when the Controller exits.
Registers a control and its associated help text in the global map.
Message monitor function handling contextual hover help.
Appends timestamped text to the LogBox GUI control and auto-scrolls.
Processes "STOP" or "RELOAD" commands to manage worker signaling and GUI states.
Math utility to restrict a value between a minimum and maximum range.
Randomized short sleep logic based on configured micro-delay chance.
Evaluates break chance and cooldown to pause execution for a random duration.
Returns boolean based on the configured overshoot percentage chance.
The primary "Checkpoint" to be called within the Worker's loop.
Evaluates chance and triggers a randomized micro-pause if enabled.
Handles evaluation logic for break chance, spacing, and duration selection.
Execution logic for breaks including overlay notifications and weighted durations.
Helper to safely check for a global function's existence without reserved word errors.
Worker-side function to listen for WM_TRIGGER_STATE messages.
Processes incoming state signals (Run, Pause, Reset) and adjusts timer offsets.
Controller-side function to toggle Worker state via window messages.
Checks if a process ID currently exists.
Suspends a process via ntdll\NtSuspendProcess.
Resumes a suspended process via ntdll\NtResumeProcess.
Detects if an executable is an AutoHotkey v1 version.
Calculates the hypotenuse (magnitude) of a 2D vector.

column4: Calculates mouse path.

Utility to sort a coordinate array in ascending or descending order.
High-level wrapper. Applies circular randomization and muscle memory decay (10s interval).
Calculates and moves mouse relative to current position with dynamic speed.
Core validation function: reads, deobfuscates, parses, and hashes license data against HWID.
Decrypts Base64 input using an internal salt-based XOR stream cipher.
Generates a verification SHA256-equivalent hash from sorted license key-value pairs.
Retrieves the unique hardware identifier (MachineGuid) from the Windows Registry.
Resolves the absolute path to settings.ini by checking the local and parent directories.
Retrieves a specific value from the INI file with a fallback default.
Writes a key-value pair to the designated section in the INI file.
Updates the visual HUD text and color.
Built-in message handler for IPC WM_COPYDATA.
Callback function that decodes string data sent from the Controller.
Initializes global g_Config map and syncs local logic variables with INI settings.
Performs window tracking, visibility logic, and spring physics calculations to update overlay position.
IPC handler to update the target window title in the worker's configuration map.
Calculates total active execution time (subtracting paused time) and updates the HUD timer.
Polls the INI file's modification time; triggers config reload and visual "Sync" flash if changed.
Logic to update overlay status text and map descriptive color names to hex codes.

Semantic version tracking for the Main Controller.
Path to project visual identity asset.
Primary UI title variable.
Centralized container for all active INI settings.
[CRITICAL] Watchdog baseline. Must stay 0 until first tick.
Current operational mode: "active", "paused", or "inactive".
TickCount recorded when worker switches from inactive to active.
Cumulative milliseconds spent in "paused" state to offset timer.
TickCount recorded at the moment the pause began.
Target window title retrieved from settings or IPC update.
Handle to the Controller window for sending Return Messages.
Unique internal HWND name for process identification.
Global reference to the GUI Edit control for logging.
Process ID of the active Worker; used for lifecycle management.
GUI State: Toggle for showing the visual overlay.
GUI State: Toggle for minimizing to system tray on close.
User-defined target window title for the Worker process.
Toggle for generic anti-ban pattern generation.
Toggle for high-speed item dropping logic.
Toggle for automated health management routines.
Toggle for randomized coordinate offsets on clicks.
Standardized human-modeling delay (ms) for Anti-Ban logic.
Toggle for human-like mouse overshooting logic.
Maximum percentage of distance to overshoot target.
Toggle for long-duration human-like break system.
Percentage chance (1-100) to take a break.
Minimum minutes required between consecutive breaks.
Toggle for short randomized pauses between actions.
Ceiling (ms) for randomized micro-delay durations.
Percentage chance (1-100) for a micro-delay to trigger.
Global toggle to enable/disable jitter logic in Movement.ahk.
Range: 1-5px. Defines the max tremor distance during pathing.
Temporary storage for debounced game title updates.
Cached window handle for the Worker process.
COPYDATASTRUCT buffer used for IPC transmission.
Global map storing control HWNDs and their help text.

Current interpolated X coordinate of the overlay.
Current interpolated Y coordinate of the overlay.
Current horizontal velocity for spring physics.
Current vertical velocity for spring physics.
Constant determining the 'snappiness' of the overlay tracking.

column3: ANY change to logic or structure MUST be reflected in the code, 'INDEXIDLIST.txt', '_PROJECT_BLUEPRINT.txt', and the authoritative 'GLOBAL_REGISTRY_MASTER.gsheet'. The 'GLOBAL_REGISTRY_MASTER.csv' MUST be updated simultaneously to maintain a 1:1 literal fallback mirror.

ANY change, addition, removal, edit or otherwise to any project file (excluding the registry, and all runtime artifacts or otherwise non-readable files) must be accompanied by a separate 'version header' code block as defined by `STANDARDIZED_HEADERS.txt`

You must FULLY ANALYZE the relevant files using the SEARCH & INDEXING PROTOCOL to ensure the current file state is the same as the users before ANY change, addition, removal, edit or otherwise to any project file.
g_LastSettingsUpdate MUST be 0 at launch to trigger initial sync flash (Cyan).
WorkerState.ahk is the SOLE owner of the synchronization timestamp.
Every message receiver (OnMessage) must be wrapped in a Try/Catch block.
If ControllerHWND is > 0, Worker signals success back to Controller.
\Lib functions must use HasFunc()/IsSet() before calling Overlay/Messenger.
A break (AFK) always overrides and pauses a Micro-Delay.
Overlay movement must run on a 10ms Timer independent of Main Loop.
If distance < sleepThreshold, velocity = 0.0 and calculation halts.
